va-gq-166: The meeting discussed the Aurora speech recognition system, specifically the VAD (Voice Activity Detection) and noise reduction techniques. The team reviewed the results of the SRI system, which showed an improvement in word error rate from 3.9% to 2.7% on the Meeting Recorder digits test, but a worsening of near-mike performance. The team also discussed the use of mean subtraction, which improved the SRI system's performance, but may not be effective for all types of noise. They also talked about the use of Wiener filtering, which showed promise, but needs further investigation. Additionally, the team discussed the use of VTS (Vocal Tract Space) and its potential benefits and limitations. They also considered combining different techniques, such as VAD and noise reduction, to improve the system's performance. The meeting concluded with a plan to continue testing and evaluating different approaches.
